title: What is the difference of Pre-colonial period, American period, and Spanish period? - Quora
tags: History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Pre-Colonial and pre-Colombian mean the same thing, before before Europeans began colonizing the Americas. Colonial period was the period from 1492 to 1776 for U.S.-America, and for Spain it ended in 1898 when they lost their last two Western Hemisphere colonies, Cuba and Puerto Rico. The American period is after 1776 with the formation of the United States of America. The Spanish period is part of the colonial period, but is only considering the Spanish Colonies, so from 1492 to 1898.
